Personal Statement

Professional developer with excellent problem solving skills demonstrated by 7 years of successful development experience with multiple companies and teams. Passion for programming, specially web applications using the best practices in the industry. Self Motivated with a strong desire to continuous learning. Specialize in coding effective and efficient JavaScript solutions.

Projects

GE Site Builder

Link:(Only available in GE's intranet)

Software suite with various web tools used to generate GE's country sites.

I was part of the SiteBuilder consultant team from 2011 to 2012 we were in chage to make maintenence and improvements.

Technologies used: HTML CSS JavaScript jQuery

GE Page Editor

Link:(Only available in GE's intranet)

This tool was part of the SiteBuilder Suite. It was an online WYSIWYG website authoring tool with drag n' drop capabilities.

I worked in bug fixing as well as implementing new tools and widgets for the application.

Technologies used: HTML CSS JavaScript jQuery

GE Colab

Link:(Only available in GE's intranet)

This social network and collaboration platform was one of the key projects for GE Digital Media Technologies team at the time an very visible within GE. The application is currently used by 300K+ GE's employees and contractors.

I had the opportunity to participate in this project almost from the very beginning which is a great since you get to know all the ins and outs of the application, participate in taking design decisions and gain a lot of experience.

Technologies used: HTML CSS JavaScript jQuery Backbone.js Node.js Mongoose Express.js MongoDB Grunt

BTS BUMP

Link:http://bump.bluetrailsoft.com/

This social network application was developed in the hope to raise VC money to sell it as a B2B application to enable better communication between geographically distributed companies.

The team was struggling with meeting deadlines and new bugs introduced every release. The project was in a critical situation, release date was overdue by a couple of months and I was thrown into the mix in the hope that my experience could be of any help. I introduced the team to JSHint, automated builds with gulp, PM2 for production server, correct usage of GIT, a new work-flow using various branches for different states in the development cycle (master, next, sprint and feature branches), refactor huge monolithic files into manageable files which does a single thing each, get ride of lots of duplicated code introducing a single source of truth for each function and the use of node-debug instead of “console.log” for debugging.

Technologies used: HTML CSS JavaScript AngularJS jQuery Backbone.js Node.js Mongoose Express.js MongoDB Bootstrap SASS Gulp

Rainbow.js

Link:
http://jorgeriv.github.io/rainbowjs/

Git:
https://github.com/jorgeriv/rainbowjs

RainbowJS offers a solution to perform color operations as converting from different formats (eg. rgb to hsv), create color palettes based on color theory harmmonies. Is highly configurable and works both in the browser and node.

Technologies used: JavaScript EcmaScript 2015

Twitter Bot

Link:https://twitter.com/

This twitter bot scraps the google trends page for keywords that are trending search terms at the moment and then searches google and twit the first search result, also checks youtube trending videos and share them.

The bot is deployed in a heroku Dyno.

Update:Seems like after all this years google has blocked my bot to scrap their site for information which is sad ☹

Technologies used: JavaScript twitter api Node.js

Personal site

Link:This website

Git:
https://github.com/jorgeriv/personal-site

This is my personal website which I released as an OpenSource project on github. I had this idea of a personal webiste and blog for quite some time and finally was able to materialize this.

I build this website from the ground up, I didn't use any CMS software like wordpress or drupal because this website is meant to be a place where I can experiment building every part by myself using all kind of languages, libraries and frameworks in the front-end and back-end, its a work in progress and always will be, it's like a living website evolving all the time.

Technologies used: HTML5 CSS3 EcmaScript2015 AngularJS PureCSS Node.js LoopBack MongoDB

wedding site

Link:Not online yet

Git:
https://github.com/jorgeriv/wedding

The idea of this website was to have some real world example for my fiancée to learn web technologies at the same time that we both build our wedding website. This project is released as OpenSource on github and still a work in progress.

Technologies used: HTML5 CSS3 EcmaScript2015 AngularJS custom css framework Node.js LoopBack MongoDB

Swarm Intel

This is my most recent project. I got the ideas of this site when reading about a artificial intelligence which one of my hobbies. It will be a tool to create a group intelligence also referred as swarm intelligence.

I don't wanna spill the beans and give away the secret sauce to the Internet just yet, currently the project is in a very early stage you may wanna come later to see updates on this.
